page.title: 01BEENHAM
page.content: BEENHAM STANDS ON A WOODED RIDGE OVERLOOKING THE A4 WITHIN EASY REAACH OF THE M4 AND MAINLINE RAILWAY SERVICE TOLONDON. THE VILLAGE IS A MIXTURE OF OLD AND NEW. THE BUILDING OF MANY EXPENSIVE HOUSES HAS BROUGHT CHANGE. E.SOME ROMAN REMAINS WERE FOUND DURING EXCAVATIONS BY MARLEY TILES &THERE ARE TIES WITH HISTORIC ENGLEFIELD.BEENHAM GALA SUPPORTS LOCAL AND NATIONAL CHARITIES ANNUALLY. BUTLER'S FARM IS THE HOME FOR THE TAME WOLVES SEEN IN T.V PRODUCTION OF "BOX OF DELIGHTS"MR. GERALD BENNY, RENOWNED SILVERSMITH RESIDE IN THE VILLAGE. THE WOODS WHICH SURROUND BEENHAM LIKE GREYFIELD AND HIGHWOOD TEAM WITH WILD LIFE.THERE ARE TWO LOCAL PUBS "THE SIX BELLS" AND "THE STOCKS" ARE THE TWO LOCAL HOSTELERIES. LOCAL ASSOCIATIONS WITH THE CIVIL AND ITS GHOSTS.
